qas.question: What country ruled CAR as a colony?
Who was the first democratically elected President?
What religion is a minority in CAR?
When was General Francois Bozize removed in a coup?
In what year did the Ange-Felix Patasse war begin?
What did the muslim minority establish in the Central Africal Republic?
At what time did various factions begin to rule the ACR as a colony?
In what year did the ACR gain independence from General Francois Bozize?

context: What is today the Central African Republic has been inhabited for millennia; however, <b7_0>the country's current borders<b7_0/> were established by <a0_0>France<a0_0/>, which ruled the country as a colony starting <b8_0>in the late 19th century<b8_0/>. After gaining independence from <a1_0>France<a1_0/> <a2_0><b9_0>in 1960<b9_0/><a2_0/>, the Central African Republic was ruled by a series of autocratic leaders; by the 1990s, calls for democracy led to the first multi-party democratic elections in 1993. <a3_0>Ange-Félix Patassé<a3_0/> became president, but was later removed by General François Bozizé in the <b5_0>2003<b5_0/> coup. The Central African Republic Bush War began <b6_0>in 2004<b6_0/> and, despite a peace treaty in 2007 and another in 2011, fighting broke out between various factions in December 2012, leading to ethnic and religious cleansing of the <a4_0>Muslim minority<a4_0/> and massive population displacement in 2013 and 2014.
